Richard fitz le Reg, A, Harl. MS., 6137, fo. 89, b, and attributed to William I and II, Robert duke of Normandy, Henry I, the Empress Maud, Stephen, Henry II until his marriage 1151 with Eleanor of Aquitaine, and John Plantagenet while Lord of Ireland and Earl of Mortaigne, Z, 1, --59; attributed with the lions two the sinister side) to Richard I, Ducarel, Antiquities, p. 30. Erdington, co. Salop. Erdington, co. Warwick, temp. Henry VI. Attributed to William Fetz-Aculph, Lord of Dudley, temp. William I, who was succeeded bay Paganel Paganell or Painel; seal of Gervase Paganell, 1187, Monasticon, v, 204; by marriage with whose heiress John de Somery had the manor of Dudley. Robert de Somerye, A. Roger de Sumeri, A, Harl. MS., 6137; or Somery, B, C; or Someri, E; or Somerby, F. Sir Johan de Sumeri, J; or Someri, N. Roger Somery, Y. Sir .... de Somery, co. Warwick, temp. Edward I, V. John de Sutton, by marriage with the eldest coheir of Somery, obtained 1332-42, the manor of Dudly, and founded the family of Sutton alias Dudley barons of Dudley extinct in the male line 1643; the heiress m. Ward; the barony fell into abeyance 1757. William Dudley, Bishop of Durham 1476-83 quartering (for Sutton) arg. a cross patonce az.; seal in Surtees, Durham. Dudley, co. Stafford. Percivall. Sleswick, Z, 554.
